name: NPR
text:
President-elect Biden has introduced 5 additional Cabinet nominees, including several Obama administration alumni, saying they will help him address inequality in the country.
https://t.co/flp4m8OHCQ

name: NPR
text:
Many officials are relying on personal responsibility to stop the viral spread. But in the time it might take for the human perception of COVID-19 illness risk to catch up to reality, thousands more people could die.
 https://t.co/XJzj1zW8w9

name: NPR
text:
The Alabama Dept. of Corrections says it will "fervently defend" its system against a lawsuit from the Justice Dept. this week alleging brutal and unconstitutional conditions inside the state's prisons.
https://t.co/Bvkf4Ldmof

name: NPR
text:
As 2020 comes to an end, @NPRWeekend wants to hear about what hardships you've experienced this year that helped you grow, learn something new, or change your perspective.

Share your story in the form at this link, and a producer may contact you.
https://t.co/gQ5v42jikS

name: NPR
text:
Hours after a Wisconsin lower court rejected another of President Trump's attempts to overturn his loss to President-elect Joe Biden, the state Supreme Court agreed to hear arguments in the case.
https://t.co/7w5XwvxKM1

name: NPR
text:
The musician FKA twigs has filed a lawsuit against her ex-boyfriend Shia LaBeouf, accusing him of abusing her "physically, mentally and emotionally" during their nearly year-long relationship which began in 2018.
https://t.co/Vdh4BjQzFa

name: NPR
text:
President Trump has signed a one-week funding measure to temporarily avert a government shutdown — just hours before the midnight deadline on Friday.
https://t.co/0uFKppmX07

name: NPR
text:
RT @davidfolkenflik: New VOA chief sparks outcry for views on Islam & gays

“I really implore people across the political spectrum to read some of the hate-filled and dehumanizing things Robert Reilly has written," says ex USAGM acting CEO Grant Turner, who is gay 

My story:  https://t.co/pon6RnjgKo

name: NPR
text:
In the absence of vaccine trial data on pregnant people, the call on whether to get vaccinated will likely come down to a conversation with your doctor.
https://t.co/Sb2z2B5b5r

name: NPR
text:
BREAKING: The FDA has authorized Pfizer's COVID-19 vaccine for emergency use, radically altering the fight against the coronavirus. Officials say it may be ready for widespread inoculations within days.
https://t.co/BZMHc9JMMJ

name: NPR
text:
A WHO analysis of global deaths over the past 20 years finds that dementia and diabetes are claiming more lives, while infectious diseases like HIV and tuberculosis are taking far fewer.
https://t.co/EGZBAxoryH

name: NPR
text:
A former U.S. Marine has been found guilty of attempting to smuggle firearms into Haiti while on active duty. Court records show he expressed a desire to "train the Haitian police, and run for president of Haiti."
https://t.co/3H6e777sQ1

name: NPR
text:
As part of his plan on criminal justice reform, President-elect Biden pledged to make juvenile justice a priority.

But after 4 years of setbacks under President Trump, some activists still worry about what they call an ongoing crisis.
https://t.co/Ghvv4NV9qA

name: NPR
text:
They're called "forever prisoners" — held at Guantánamo without charge or trial.
 
There are dozens of them.
 
And now, in a rare development, one has been cleared for release after 18 years behind bars.
https://t.co/hNLZC1yTVd

name: NPR
text:
Director Christopher Nolan, whose blockbuster movies for Warner Bros. have made billions, called the shift to streaming in Hollywood "a sign of great danger" for working people in the movie industry.
https://t.co/URje0SlKhM

name: NPR
text:
In 1991, Texas passed a law to remove the word "Negro" from the names of geographic features. 

Nearly 30 years later, over two dozen still have the word in their names.

That’s because the federal government blocked the name changes. https://t.co/d3TQggxrpJ

name: NPR
text: Time is money, but how much exactly? For the average American, an hour is worth about $19, a study of Lyft riders found. @PlanetMoney explains: https://t.co/lIWEXxBIOL

name: NPR
text: "You’re great doctors but you run a crappy hotel": For chronically ill patients who can fend for themselves, a growing hospital-at-home model offers more comfort and family time than an inpatient stay -- and frees up beds for coronavirus patients. @CPRNews https://t.co/iTHZ5giwpx

name: NPR
text:
The Voice of America is intended to model how independent journalism works across the globe and to convey American pluralism by fairly depicting political debate. 

But its new director has a history of homophobic and anti-Islamic writings.
https://t.co/KMYVc9x3ed

name: NPR
text: The 25-story apartment building planned for Milwaukee could become the tallest wooden building in the world. The builders say its mass timber architecture has big environmental benefits over concrete and steel construction. @WUWMradio https://t.co/EZaXvFJvgh

name: NPR
text:
When the federal government failed to step up, a deep-pocketed nonprofit gave local governments the funding they needed to handle this year's unprecedented voter turnout. 

Some officials say it saved the election. Others see a dangerous precedent. https://t.co/WH6Babe4le

name: NPR
text: Being alone, away from friends, colleagues, and clubs, @BobBoilen connected deeply with music that drew him in with subtlety, yearning and quietude. Here's a playlist of his favorites from our strange year: https://t.co/ni8ce61DAV

name: NPR
text:
Remember: Dress like an onion. 
https://t.co/BhjEwycT7M

name: NPR
text: Happy Hanukkah! Here are book recommendations to last you (at least!) eight days and nights. https://t.co/UEQEWLRS9E

name: NPR
text:
After Sarah Fuller helped lead Vanderbilt to an SEC soccer championship, she got a surprise call: 

"Have you ever kicked a football before?"

Then, she made history as the 1st woman to play a football game in the Power Five.
https://t.co/unMqXURpvy

name: NPR
text: Deep in the Amazon jungle and high overhead, archeologists have found tens of thousands of red ochre paintings strewn across eight miles of cliffside. They date back about 12,500 years. @hereandnow https://t.co/DyYFEPEy6D

name: NPR
text:
To photographer Bob Gruen, rock and roll is "the freedom to express your feelings very loudly in public."

He spent decades capturing that freedom in the lives and shows of the biggest bands in the world. https://t.co/EoCO0qraNJ
